title.rendered: Super Bowl tickets are the most expensive in history

content.rendered:
The Los Angeles Rams and the Cincinnati Bengals will play the Super Bowl final next Sunday. ETIENNE LAURENT EFE

Next Sunday, February 13, the Sofi Stadium in Inglewood (California) host the Super Bowl Finals Come in Los Angeles Rams and Cincinnati Bengals. The most important sporting event in the United States is on its way to breaking all records in ticket prices.

It won’t just be the millions of dollars advertisers pay for the advertising which is broadcast during the match. Spectators who want to go to the stadium will have to shell out figures never seen before to experience it live.

The desire to attend live events, after the last wave of infections from the covid-19 pandemic, and the fact that the final of the National Football League (NFL) disputed in the second largest metropolitan area in the country has resulted in a explosive combination.

home team, Los Angeles Rams, is facing the opportunity to get the second title in its history in its own territory. The first was conquered in 2000 when they were still playing as a team from Saint Louis (Missouri). To this is added, a city full of millionaires and ‘celebrities’ who will not want to miss the first final to be played there in 30 years.

“This is Los Angeles. The entertainment capital of the world, where the prices of everything are through the roof. We are facing a perfect storm,” he explains. Adam Budellispokesperson for the ticket sales platform StubHub to the CNN network.

If in past editions at least $1,000 (875 euros) for a seat in the last ring of the stadium, this year the cheapest is already over 5,500 dollars, according to the tickets that were still available this Monday on StubHub. A price that is expected to increase as the match date approaches.

In the first rows of the wings, the most expensive areas of the stadium and closest to the team benches, the most expensive chair is $48,000 not including sales commissions. The Bengals are also facing a historic moment with the possibility of winning their first Vince Lombardi Trophy, after losing two Finals in 1982 and 1989.

Not forgetting the rest show that attracts more viewers than the game itself. This year, the performance will be performed by the legendary hip hop singer and producer dr dreand the rappers Snoop Doog, Eminem, Mary J. Blige and Kendrick Lamar.
